Despite its many innovations, ENIAC lacked certain features considered essential to modern computing systems. Without the ability to store a program in its own memory--a feature known as the stored program concept--ENIAC had to be manually wired to execute a particular program. John Mauchly and J.
Did ENIAC have memory for storing programs? ENIAC memory storage capability

At present the ENIAC has only 20 words of internal memory, in the form of electronic accumulators. This small memory capacity limits the size of the problem that can be programmed without repeated reference to the external punched-card memory.

detail.reasoning: The given text states that ENIAC had no memory for data storage. However, the evidences indicate that while ENIAC did not have RAM or a traditional memory system at its inception, it did have a form of memory. It had 20 accumulators, each capable of storing 10-digit decimal numbers, which provided a total memory of about 200 decimal digits. Additionally, punch cards could be used for external memory storage. Therefore, the claim that ENIAC had no memory is incorrect.
detail.error: The text incorrectly states that ENIAC had no memory for data storage.

evidences: Did ENIAC have memory for storing programs? ENIAC memory storage capability

Despite its many innovations, ENIAC lacked certain features considered essential to modern computing systems. Without the ability to store a program in its own memory--a feature known as the stored program concept--ENIAC had to be manually wired to execute a particular program. John Mauchly and J.
Did ENIAC have memory for storing programs? ENIAC memory storage capability

At present the ENIAC has only 20 words of internal memory, in the form of electronic accumulators. This small memory capacity limits the size of the problem that can be programmed without repeated reference to the external punched-card memory.

ای این آئی اے سی فنکشن ٹیبلز استعمال کرتا تھا ENIAC function tables usage

ENIAC Function Table. This function table, one of three originally used with ENIAC, stored numerical constants. It is the equivalent of "programmable read-only memory" (PROM) in modern computers. ENIAC solved mathematical equations.
